page.title: 03EDUCATION IN AREA
page.content: State education in the area is based upon a 3 tier system. Children from 5 to 9 years attend Flyford Flavell School - mainly being transported by bus from local villages. Bishampton sends the majority of children (about 4O) whilst smaller numbers from Throckmorton, Abberton, North Piddle, Grafton Flyford, Kington and Dormston also attend. At present about 7O children attend Flyford School but numbers have slowly fallen in recent years owing to trends in population and a fall in the national birth rate. At 9, children start at St.Nicholas Middle School, Pinvin which they attend for 3 years until 12. Again they are transported by bus. After 12 children go to Pershore High School until they leave at some time after they reach the age of 16. The 3 tier system was introduced about 9 years
